trans-unit.source: Provides utility methods to compose and parse pack URI objects.
Returns a value that indicates whether two pack URIs are equivalent.
When comparing pack URIs, a null URI is always less than a non-null URI.
For cases where `firstPackUri` and `secondPackUri` are both absolute pack URIs, <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.ComparePackUri%2A> performs the comparison.
A signed integer indicating the relationship between firstPackUri and secondPackUri.
Either firstPackUri or secondPackUri is not an absolute [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)].
Either firstPackUri or secondPackUri do not begin with a "pack://" scheme.
Returns a value that indicates whether two package part [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-urisharpplural-md.md)] are equivalent.

When comparing <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-urisharpplural-md.md)], a null [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] is always less than a non-null [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)].
For cases where `firstPartUri` and `secondPartUri` are both relative <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> URIs, <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.ComparePartUri%2A> performs the comparison.
A value that indicates the relationship between firstPartUri and secondPartUri.
firstPartUri or secondPartUri is not a valid part [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] syntax.
Creates a new pack URI that points to a package.
`packageUri` may not be specified as `null` or empty.
The following table illustrates sample cases for <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.Create%2A>.
Composing a pack URI is a multi-step process.
For example, one step in forming a pack URI is to replace the forward slash (/) characters of the `packageUri` with commas (,).

For more information on string conversion and how pack URIs are formed, see Appendix A.4 "String Conversion Examples" and Appendix B.3 "Composing a Pack URI" in the Open Packaging Conventions specification available for download at [Specifications and License Downloads](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
The pack URI for the referenced by the given packageUri.

Creates a pack URI given a <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] and the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of a part in the package.
`packageUri` may not be specified as null or empty.
If `partUri` is `null`, the returned pack URI points to the package.
The following table illustrates sample cases for the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.Create%2A> method.
Composing a pack URI is a multi-step process.
For example, one step in forming a pack URI is to replace the forward slash (/) characters of the `packageUri` with commas (,).

For more information on string conversion and how pack URIs are formed, see Appendix A.4 "String Conversion Examples" and Appendix B.3 "Composing a Pack URI" in the Open Packaging Conventions specification available for download at [Specifications and License Downloads](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref> in the package.
The pack URI of the given <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref>.
partUri is not a valid part URI syntax.

Creates a pack URI given a <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)], the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of a part in the package, and a "#" fragment to append.
`packageUri` may not be specified as `null` or empty.
If `partUri` is `null`, the returned pack URI points to the package.
`fragment` cannot be an empty string but can be specified as `null`.
When not specified as `null`, the `fragment` string must begin with a '#' character.
For more information of the syntax of `fragment` references, see Section 3.5 "Fragment" of [RFC 3986](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt).
The following table illustrates sample cases for the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.Create%2A> method.
Composing a pack URI is a multi-step process.
For example, one step in forming a pack URI is to replace the forward slash (/) characters of the `packageUri` with commas (,).

For more information on string conversion and how pack URIs are formed, see Appendix A.4 "String Conversion Examples" and Appendix B.3 "Composing a Pack URI" in the Open Packaging Conventions specification available for download at [Specifications and License Downloads](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref> in the package.
A "#" reference identifying an element within the package part.
The pack URI that identifies the specified package, package part, and fragment.
partUri is not a valid part URI syntax.
fragment is empty or does begin with "#".
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> is always referenced from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> root.

The returned <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> URI is an absolute path that always starts with "/" and conforms to the syntax defined in the [Open Packaging Conventions Specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
The following table illustrates sample cases for <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.CreatePartUri%2A>.
The URI of the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref> within the package.
Returns the normalized form of a specified <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref> URI.

<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.GetNormalizedPartUri%2A> normalizes `partUri` by case-folding to uppercase (<xref:System.String.ToUpperInvariant%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) and returning the result.
The normalized form of the given partUri.
Returns the inner URI that points to the entire package of a specified pack URI.
The following table illustrates sample cases for <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.GetPackageUri%2A>.
The pack URI from which to return the URI of the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref>.
The URI of the from the specified packUri.
Returns the URI of a <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref> within a specified pack URI.

The returned <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> URI is relative to the package root and is an absolute path that always starts with "/" and conforms to the syntax defined in the [Open Packaging Conventions Specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
The following table illustrates sample cases for <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.GetPartUri%2A>.
The pack URI from which to return the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref> URI.
The URI of the in the given packUri, or `null` if packUri points to a package instead of a .
Returns the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the relationship part associated with a specified <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref>.
`partUri` must identify either the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> ("/") or a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> that is not a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship> part.

For more information about <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship> parts, see Section 9.3 "Relationships" in the Open Packaging Conventions Specification available for download at [Specifications and License Downloads](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).

The <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Uri"></xref> of the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref> to return the URI for the associated <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship"></xref>.
The URI of the part associated with the identified by partUri.
partUri syntax is not valid for a package part URI.

Returns the relative [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] between two specified <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart"></xref> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-urisharpplural-md.md)].
The following table illustrates sample cases for <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.GetRelativeUri%2A>.

Returns the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.SourceUri"></xref> from the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship"></xref> with a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)].

The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.SourceUri%2A> property of a relationship part must identify either the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A> ("/") or a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> that is not a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship>.

For example, if the package part "/files/document.xaml" is the source owner of the relationship part "/files/_rels/document.xaml.rels", calling <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.GetSourcePartUriFromRelationshipPartUri%2A> with the `relationshipPartUri` parameter of "/files/_rels/document.xaml.rels" returns the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.SourceUri%2A> of "/files/document.xaml".
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the relationship part to return the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.SourceUri"></xref> from.
The of the from the relationship with the specified relationshipPartUri.
relationshipPartUri syntax is not valid for a .
relationshipPartUri does not reference a relationship part.
The <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.SourceUri"></xref> of the relationship part references another relationship part (not valid).

Returns a value that indicates whether a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] is the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of a <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship"></xref> part.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] to check for a <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship"></xref> part.
Returns a part URI given a source part URI and a URI with a relative path to a target part.
The following table illustrates sample cases for <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackUriHelper.ResolvePartUri%2A>.
The URI of the source part, or "/" to designate the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> root.
The relative URI to the target part.
The URI of the target part resolved between the specified SourcePartUri and the targetUri parameters.
sourcePartUri is not a valid part URI.
targetUri is not a valid relative URI.
Defines the pack URI scheme name "pack".
